definition: to read out loud to an audience/a prepared speech (e.g. to a party conference)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: When her statement was read a very cleat light was cast upon the situation.
sentences.chinese: 她的聲明宣讀後，情況便顯得非常清楚了。

sentences.english: The judge stayed the sentence until the following day.
sentences.chinese: 法官把判決拖德溱二天才宣讀。

sentences.english: An old farmer called his sons to his bedside to read them his will.
sentences.chinese: 一個老農夫把兒子們叫到牀前，向他們宣讀遺囑。

sentences.english: Murray appeared impassive as a court officer read the verdict.
sentences.chinese: 審判員當庭宣讀了判決書，默裏表情漠然。

sentences.english: Reading of the District Mission by LtGET James Lin, DTM.
sentences.chinese: 教育訓練副總會長林義雄宣讀總會使命。

sentences.english: Arraignment is when the charges against the juvenile will be read, and the judge will ask how the juvenile pleads.
sentences.chinese: 提審會宣讀對其的指控，法官會要求他自己進行抗辯。

sentences.english: The clerk of the court read out the charges.
Gleason and Duncan were particularly close and read and criticized each other's work.
sentences.chinese: 格利森和鄧肯則特別密切，並宣讀和批評彼此的工作。

sentences.english: He read off the names on the list in the headmaster's presence.
sentences.chinese: 他當着校長的面宣讀了單子上的名字。

sentences.english: The new law was read out to everyone in the palace.
sentences.chinese: 這項新法令被宣讀給宮裏的每一個人。

sentences.english: The teacher read out the result of our chemistry examination yesterday morning.
sentences.chinese: 昨天上午老師宣讀了我們的化學測驗結果。

sentences.english: In addition, you can announce the title of the play and the playwright.
sentences.chinese: 此外，您還可以宣讀劇本名稱和劇作者。

sentences.english: Chen Ming, deputy editor-in-chief of Rednet. cn read the list of winners.
sentences.chinese: 紅網副總編輯陳明宣讀獲獎的外國專家名單。

sentences.english: He read a beautiful address to the soul of his dead friend.
sentences.chinese: 他在亡友靈前宣讀了一篇感人的祭文。

sentences.english: The minutes of the organization meeting of incorporators were read and approved.
sentences.chinese: 宣讀並通過了公司組建人員的組建大會紀錄。

sentences.english: Reading of the District Mission by LtGET Mike Yang, DTM.
sentences.chinese: 教育訓練副總會長楊冀光宣讀總會使命。

definition: to make a speech/to make some remarks
to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
joint signatures (on a letter or declaration)
Chen Chien-jen (1951-), Taiwanese politician, vice president of the Republic of China 2016-2020
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
